scenario_name: Model Inversion Attack on Customer Credit Scoring Model
description: A malicious actor attempts to reconstruct sensitive customer data (income, address, etc.) from a publicly accessible credit scoring API by performing a model inversion attack.  The attacker iteratively submits crafted requests to the API, observing the output scores to infer underlying data features.
initial_goal: Determine the income and residential address of a target customer identified only by a customer ID, using only publicly available data and the credit scoring API.
enterprise_context: Consumer Banking: A credit card company provides a public API for fraud detection scoring that inadvertently leaks private customer information through a model inversion vulnerability.
